metadata.product: TruSkin Vitamin C Serum for Face with Hyaluronic Acid & Vitamin E

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Good afternoon, Barbara. Thank you so much for taking the time to speak with me today. My name is Chris, and I’m a representative from TruSkin. We're conducting some customer feedback interviews to better understand our users' experiences, and your detailed review of our Vitamin C Serum really stood out to us. We truly value all feedback, especially when it helps us identify areas for improvement.

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Oh, hello Chris. Yes, I saw your email. I'm happy to talk about it, though I'm not sure how much more I can add beyond what I wrote. It really was quite a frustrating experience.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: I completely understand, and we appreciate your honesty. The goal here isn't to rehash the review, but rather to delve a little deeper into your specific journey with the product, understand the context, and hear your voice directly. No need to feel pressured; just speak openly. Does that sound okay?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Yes, that's fine. I'm happy to share.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Wonderful. To start, could you tell me a bit about what initially drew you to the TruSkin Vitamin C Serum? What were you hoping to achieve for your skin when you decided to purchase it?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Well, you know, at my age, I’m always looking for something that can help with the general signs of aging. I’ve noticed some dullness, and of course, those inevitable fine lines are becoming more prominent. I’d also been seeing a few, well, I guess you’d call them sunspots, appearing. I did a fair bit of research online, and Vitamin C serums kept coming up as this powerhouse ingredient for brightening and collagen support. Your product, specifically, had just so many glowing reviews, pun intended. I thought, "This sounds like exactly what I need – something to give my skin a lift, a bit of that youthful radiance back." I’ve tried other serums before, but nothing that specifically focused on Vitamin C quite like yours seemed to.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That's very clear. So, brightening, collagen support, and addressing those age-related spots were your primary goals. And you'd seen a lot of positive buzz around Vitamin C in general. When you first started using the serum, can you describe your initial impressions, particularly regarding the texture and how it felt on your skin?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Oh, the texture. That was one of the first things that really put me off. From the very first day, it just felt... sticky. Incredibly sticky. And I don’t mean a little bit tacky, I mean like I had honey on my face. I'm used to serums absorbing quite quickly, leaving my skin feeling smooth and prepped for the next step. But this one just sat there. I tried using less, a tiny drop, but it didn't seem to make a difference. It just felt heavy, like there was a film on my skin.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Sticky, heavy, like a film. That certainly doesn't sound like the comfortable experience we aim for. Can you tell me a bit more about how that texture impacted your morning routine? You mentioned in your review that it was a "pain to incorporate."

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Yes, definitely. My mornings are usually a bit of a rush, even though I'm not working right now. I have my routine, and it needs to be efficient. With your serum, I'd apply it, then I’d wait, and wait, and wait some more, trying to let it sink in. But it just wouldn't. Then, when I’d try to put my moisturizer on top, everything would just… pill. You know, like little bits of product rolling off my face? It was awful. And if I dared try to put on any makeup – which I often do, even if it's just a tinted moisturizer – it was a disaster. It would just slide around, or cake up, and frankly, it just looked messy. So, a product that was supposed to make me feel better about my skin ended up making me feel more frustrated and self-conscious before I even left the house.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Pill, slide around, caking up... I can certainly see how that would be frustrating, especially when you're trying to get ready efficiently. It sounds like it disrupted your entire morning regimen. Beyond the texture, your review highlighted severe breakouts as a major concern. Could you elaborate on when these started and what they were like?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Oh, the breakouts. That was truly the worst part, Chris. I mean, the stickiness was annoying, but the breakouts felt like a betrayal. I started noticing them within just a few days of consistent use. Not just one or two, but a whole crop of painful, angry red spots, mostly around my chin and jawline first. Then, my forehead started getting little bumps, and even my cheeks, which are usually quite clear, developed this bumpy, almost congested texture.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Wow. And was this typical for your skin? Did you usually experience breakouts like this?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Absolutely not. I mean, I'm 50, not 15! I might get the occasional small blemish around my period, but nothing like this. This was widespread, deep, and really painful. It was genuinely reminiscent of the kind of breakouts I had in my teenage years, which was a shock. I kept thinking, "Could this be a 'purging' phase?" because I’d read about that with some active ingredients, but it just kept getting worse. After two solid weeks, my face looked significantly, *significantly* worse than before I started. I had to stop.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That sounds incredibly distressing, Barbara. To go from seeking radiance to experiencing such a severe reaction must have been very disappointing. You mentioned you had hoped for brightening and help with dark spots – did you see any improvement in those areas before you stopped using the product, or was the breakout issue too overwhelming?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Improvement? [chuckles dryly] No, absolutely not. My skin became duller, actually, from all the inflammation. And instead of fading my existing spots, I ended up with a fresh new set of angry red marks from the breakouts. The claim that it brightens skin and helps with clarity felt like a complete mockery given what it did to my face. It really felt like it did the exact opposite of everything it promised.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: I hear you. You also mentioned doing some research and finding that Witch Hazel, an ingredient in our serum, might be problematic for some skin types. Was that something you were aware of before trying the product, or did you discover it after the fact?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: No, I didn’t know until *after* the disaster. I was so desperate to understand what was happening to my skin, so I started looking up the ingredients list more closely. That’s when I came across articles suggesting Witch Hazel can be quite drying and irritating for some skin types, and for skin like mine – which I now realize can get easily thrown off balance – it can actually trigger increased oil production and more breakouts. It just felt like it completely disrupted my skin’s natural balance. If I had known that upfront, I probably would have been much more cautious.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That's valuable feedback for us regarding ingredient transparency and potential sensitivities. You also mentioned reaching out to our customer service team. Could you tell me a little about that experience?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Yes, I did. After two weeks of this nightmare, I was pretty upset. I wrote in, explaining everything that happened, hoping for some sort of explanation or, frankly, a refund. The response I got was, well, it felt very generic. It essentially suggested my skin might be "adjusting" and offered general skincare tips, which I already knew and was trying. There was no real attempt to understand the severity of my reaction or to offer a tangible solution beyond "keep trying." It felt like they weren't listening, or didn't believe me, which just added to my frustration.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: I'm very sorry to hear that your experience with our customer service was unhelpful and added to your frustration. That's certainly not the impression we want to leave. Moving beyond this specific product for a moment, what kind of skincare products have you used in the past for similar concerns – for brightening or anti-aging – that you felt *did* work well for you?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Hmm, let's see. Before this, I was using a serum from a brand called... oh, what was it? [pauses, thinking] I can’t remember the exact name, but it was a more basic hyaluronic acid serum, actually. It was fine, it absorbed beautifully, but it didn’t have the Vitamin C component I was looking for. Before that, for brightening, I used a product with niacinamide which I found quite gentle and effective. Those always left my skin feeling hydrated and smooth, never sticky, and certainly never caused breakouts. I guess I was looking to elevate my routine with Vitamin C, and well, that didn’t quite work out.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That gives us good context. So, if we were to improve the TruSkin Vitamin C Serum, based on your experience, what would be the absolute top one or two changes you would suggest we make?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: The texture, hands down. It has to absorb cleanly. No stickiness, no film. And then, I'd say, reassess the ingredients, particularly for sensitive or breakout-prone skin. If Witch Hazel is known to cause issues for some, maybe there's a gentler alternative, or at least a clearer warning for consumers. I want a serum that feels good, that I don’t have to fight with, and that won't make my skin look worse than when I started.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Clear and actionable. Thank you for that, Barbara. Given everything we've discussed, if you were considering a new Vitamin C serum today, what would be the most important factor that would make you switch to a competitor's product over trying TruSkin again, even with potential improvements?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Trust, honestly. I’ve lost trust in the brand, at least for this particular product. It would take a really significant, transparent overhaul, and maybe even a personal recommendation from someone I really trust, for me to consider it again. I’d be much more inclined to go with a brand that has a reputation for gentle, effective formulations and, frankly, better customer support if something goes wrong. I also value a clear, realistic expectation setting about what the product will do, and any potential caveats. This experience was so deeply disappointing, and honestly, a bit scarring, that my instinct would be to avoid.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That's a very honest and understandable perspective. Trust is paramount in skincare. Thank you for sharing that. This feedback is incredibly valuable for us as we look at how to refine our products and our overall customer experience. We truly appreciate your time and willingness to speak with us today, Barbara. Before we conclude, on a scale of 1 to 10, with 1 being "extremely dissatisfied" and 10 being "extremely satisfied," how would you rate your overall satisfaction with the TruSkin Vitamin C Serum based on your experience?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: Oh, hmm. Given everything, the stickiness, the terrible breakouts, the feeling that it did the opposite of what it promised, and the unhelpful customer service... I'd have to say a 1. A definite 1.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: Understood. Thank you again, Barbara. Your feedback has been incredibly insightful and will be thoroughly reviewed by our product development and customer experience teams. We genuinely value your input, and we're committed to using it to improve. Is there anything else you’d like to add or any other questions for me before we wrap up?

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: No, I think I’ve said everything. I just hope my experience helps you make things better for other customers.

transcript.speaker: Chris
transcript.text: That is precisely our hope as well. Thank you so much for your time and candor, Barbara. Have a good rest of your day.

transcript.speaker: Barbara
transcript.text: You too, Chris. Goodbye.
